name: ASSETS - Service Execution (Enrichment) (T1569.002)
description: Enriches service data and query VirusTotal for reputation. Queries SIEM for all instances of any malicious hash observed.

arguments.description: A service whose executable poses a malicious reputation was discovered on the host. Additional linked alerts may be created if logs indicate this service has executed.

steps.name: Elastic Query for execution of service
Create Elastic Alert for Service Execution

arguments.comment: SIEM query identified known malicious process {{vars.item._source.image_path.split("\\")[-1] }} executing on host {{vars.item._source.beat.hostname}} at  {{vars.item._source.event_data.UtcTime}}. This process has also been observed as service {{vars.input.params.name}} on {{vars.input.params.hostname}}.
arguments.description: Execution of a potentially malicious process was observed. This process has also been observed as a service. Attackers may utilize services to maintain persistence and execute malicious files at given intervals.

steps.name: Create malicious MD5 Indicator and link to asset
Check if MD5 is already an indicator

params.query: index=sysmon EventCode=1 MD5={{vars.input.params.md5}} | table host Image MD5 ParentImage User CommandLine process_exec vendor_product TimeCreated ParentProcessId ProcessId ParentCommandLine ProcessGuid UtcTime EventChannel

steps.name: Has indicator been submitted to VirusTotal before

resource.name: Service Identified With Unknown Reputation
resource.description:
A Windows Service was identified with a hash whose reputation is unknown. 

Task Details:
Name: {{vars.input.params.name}}
Path: {{vars.input.params.path}}
MD5: {{vars.input.params.md5}}
Host: {{vars.input.params.hostname}}

It is recommended that the file and hash associated with this service be investigated to determine whether the service is legitimate.

arguments.comment: SIEM query identified known malicious process {{vars.item.process_exec}} executing on host {{vars.item.host}} at {{vars.item.UtcTime}}. This process has also been observed as service {{vars.input.params.name}} on {{vars.input.params.hostname}}.
arguments.description: Execution of a potentially malicious process was observed. This process has also been observed as a service. Attackers may utilize services to maintain persistence and execute malicious files at given intervals.

routes.name: Has indicator been submitted to VirusTotal before -> Create unknown MD5 Indicator
Update MD5 with unknown reputation -> Create Additional Analysis Task
Is indicator malicious -> Create malicious MD5 Indicator and link to asset
Elastic Query for execution of service -> Copy  of Create Alert for Service Execution
What is existing indicator reputation -> Create Alert
Create unknown MD5 Indicator -> Create Additional Analysis Task
Create malicious MD5 Indicator and link to asset -> Create Alert
Start -> Check if MD5 is already an indicator
Return query results -> Copy  of Create Alert
Has indicator been submitted to VirusTotal before -> Update MD5 with unknown reputation
Was Indicator found -> Do Nothing2
routes.label: Indicator was not found

routes.name: Do Nothing2 -> Check MD5 Reputation
Was Indicator found -> Is existing indicator malicious
routes.label: Indicator found

routes.name: Which SIEM -> Elastic Query for execution of service
Is indicator malicious -> Copy  of Update MD5 with malicious reputation
Is indicator malicious -> Update MD5 with malicious reputation
Set Indicator IRI -> Was Indicator found
Create Alert -> Which SIEM
Has indicator been submitted to VirusTotal before -> Is indicator malicious
What is existing indicator reputation -> Do nothing
Check if MD5 is already an indicator -> Set Indicator IRI
Query for execution of service -> Return query results
Check MD5 Reputation -> Has indicator been submitted to VirusTotal before
What is existing indicator reputation -> Check MD5 Reputation
Update MD5 with malicious reputation -> Create Alert
Is indicator malicious -> Create benign MD5 Indicator
Which SIEM -> Query for execution of service
